front.title: Autocrypt v2 OpenPGP Certificates and Transferable Secret Keys

abstract.t: This document describes the "Autocrypt v2 Certificate", a standard structure for an OpenPGP certificate for Internet messaging (such as email) that offers a defense against both store-now-decrypt-later attacks from quantum computer and future key exfiltration attacks. It is also structured to support reasonable in-band transmission, using established mechanisms like the Autocrypt header field. This document also describes the structure, use, and maintenance of the OpenPGP Transferable Secret Key that corresponds with the Autocrypt v2 Certificate.
